snippet: The teen pregnancy rate hits a 30-year low, states negotiate a $26 billion deal for strapped homeowners, a year to stay flexible on tax plans and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.
abstract: The teen pregnancy rate hits a 30-year low, states negotiate a $26 billion deal for strapped homeowners, a year to stay flexible on tax plans and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and on our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

headline.main: Thursday Reading: Teen Pregnancy Rate Hits 30-Year Low
